questions.question: E½ represents which of the following parameter?

answers.d: Sum of the diffusion residual current

explanations.a: Residual current is the small current present even in absence of electroactive species. It is not E½.
explanations.b: Correct. Half-wave potential (E½) is the potential at which half of the limiting current is reached in polarography.
explanations.c: Average diffusion current refers to mean value of diffusion current, not a potential.
explanations.d: Sum of the diffusion and residual currents doesn't define E½.

questions.question: Choose the organic functional groups that are reducible at DME.

explanations.a: Nitrate is reducible at dropping mercury electrode (DME) under suitable conditions.
explanations.b: Correct. Nitrate, nitrite, and some alkenes can be reduced at DME.
explanations.c: Some alkenes can undergo electrochemical reduction at DME.
explanations.d: Nitrite is reducible and often studied using polarography.
